body: We disallow to use NULL anywhere in the library. However, I agree, that there should be a mechanism to create a content omitting optional params. I think we need to add another method.

I don't know if this is the right place, but the solution could be simply adhering to [input params guidelines](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/blob/master/src/main/java/com/jcabi/github/package-info.java), since in that case the user could choose to provide a commiter/author or not. And it would help us have less methods.
yes, makes sense, thanks for mentioning that. let's use a `Map` instead

@yegor256 sure, it's already done now

@hariso thanks for your report, I've added 15 mins to your account (ID: `DA2167209`)

Wouldn't Collections.emptyMap() work? That said, it still leaves us with the problem of needing to handle the optional branch parameter. The author and committer fields can be Map-of-Map, but what about branch?
I think we should change the signature of the method to `create(JsonObject)`. This will solve all problems.
@longtimeago this ticket is yours now, please proceed, and keep in mind [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/intro). Any technical questions you should ask right here
@longtimeago The budget of this issue is **30 mins**, which is exactly how much will be paid when the task is _done_ (see [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles) for explanation)
@hariso Please, close the issue. Thank you!
